news.title: Remains suspected to be body of missing child Daniel Aruebose exhumed as post-mortem to take place
news.summary: Gardai have now exhumed the skeletal remains they discovered during the search of waste ground in Donabate for the missing boy Daniel Areubose, and removed them from the scene.

news.title: Race to the Áras: Michael Healy-Rae nominates Maria Steen as Waterford, Wexford and Carlow councils hear from candidates
news.summary: Follow the latest developments in our live blog:

news.title: Kate O’Connor in dream start to World Championships heptathlon with personal bests in 100m hurdles and high jump
news.summary: Kate O’Connor has made a dream start to the heptathlon at the World Championships in Tokyo, the Dundalk athlete smashing her lifetime bests in the opening two events to sit joint-third overall in the points standings.

news.title: Keep the €5 pints and be ‘good craic’ – Wild Atlantic Way pub is looking for a new manager
news.summary: Does a creamy pint after a morning surfing sound appealing? Have you recently been fighting the urge to relocate to a scenic location along the Wild Atlantic Way?

news.title: Pensioner admits causing death of paedophile former Ireland rugby player David Tweed
news.summary: A North Antrim pensioner has admitted causing the death of former Ireland rugby international, unionist councillor and convicted paedophile David Tweed.

news.title: Man and woman (20s) die after crashes in Cork and Galway
news.summary: A young female cyclist has died following a collision with a truck in Cork city centre and a man in his 20s died after a crash on the N17 in Galway.

news.title: ‘I squeezed a whole house into a side passage in Bray – the results inside might surprise you’
Inside Manchester United’s transfer window strategy: Ruben Amorim support down to more than just blind faith
news.summary: One of the burning debates following last weekend’s derby was why Manchester United did not sign goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in the summer.

news.title: Bill Linnane: How I get my wife to agree to a date night – offer to drive so she can drink and promise her chips on the way home
news.summary: Who doesn’t love live music? There is an extraordinary power in seeing musicians perform in person, be it in the intimate surroundings of a pub’s back room or in a packed stadium. It’s impossible not to be moved by it, even if the genre isn’t exactly your thing.

news.title: Where the Michelin-starred chefs go to eat in Dublin: ‘It’s rare for a place to so comprehensively fulfil your hopes’
news.summary: Nobody earns a Michelin star without really knowing food. Whether it’s a slice of pizza, a curry or even just fish and chips.
